triggerPanel.activationHint: Once you’ve finished building your workflow, <a data-key=

properties.name: topics
properties.description: Topics to subscribe to, multiple can be defined with comma. Wildcard characters are supported (+ - for single level and # - for multi level). By default all subscription used QoS=0. To set a different QoS, write the QoS desired after the topic preceded by a colom. For Example: topicA:1,topicB:2

properties.name: options
properties.description: Whether to try parse the message to an object

options.name: jsonParseBody
options.description: Whether to try parse the message to an object

options.name: onlyMessage
options.description: Whether to return only the message property

options.name: parallelProcessing
options.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order

subProperties.name: jsonParseBody
subProperties.description: Whether to try parse the message to an object

subProperties.name: onlyMessage
subProperties.description: Whether to return only the message property

subProperties.name: parallelProcessing
subProperties.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

settings.note: Trigger nodes only have common settings (notes, notesInFlow)
